refnamediv.refpurpose: The manager interface on Asterisk enables users to originate (make) a call. This causes two ends to be dialled and connected together. This is often used for auto-diallinf from an application or website.

example.title: Originate Example 1
example.programlisting:
<?php
// Originating a call between two SIP phones registered on the same server.
$chan = 'SIP/234';
$ast->originateCall($chan,'SIP/216','originate-call', '293');
?>

example.title: Originate Example 2
example.programlisting:
<?php
// Originating a call between a SIP phone and an IAX tunnel to an external
// number. In this case a UK geographical number.
$chan = 'IAX2/user:pass@127.0.0.1/4401527777444';
$ast->originateCall($chan,'SIP/216','originate-call', '293');
?>
